pros: Working at Voorhees College has molded me to become better person all around. Knowing that what I do affect the students around me made the job that much easier and enjoyable as I was a student-assistant with the women's basketball team.
cons: No downsides while working with Voorhees College.

pros: Your coworkers are kind and thoughtful. Most really care about their students.
cons: Location- rural SC with little to offer. Pay is low in comparison to other places.

pros: It's a job with consistent pay and benefits.
cons: Severely underpaid. Demands are outside of job description. No raises. No bonuses. No overtime.
a bit lower than industry standard

pros: I tremendously enjoyed working and interacting with the students.  As a member of the IT team  I had the privilege of working with the Department of Energy Cyber Security program with my student interns.  This gave students who were interested in working with the Federal Governments's cyber security program an opportunity to work with some of the best minds in the government. Voorhees College gave me an opportunity to start and grow in the IT field.
cons: The school is located in a very rural area of South Carolina.  If you are not used to the country live this can be a drastic change.  Also, the pay is pretty low for information technology individuals.

review_title: It's not just a job...  it's an adventure!
pros: You and your children are able to attend college for free.
cons: Good ideas are shoved to the backburner if they do not come from certain individuals.

review_title: Nice place to work, Nice Faculty and Staff. Terrible Pay.
pros: Friendly work environment to work in.
cons: Terrible place to advance your career

job_title: Coordinator of the Writing Center in Denmark, SC
pros:
Small environment
Friendly and caring faculty and staff
Student-teacher ratio 20 to 1
cons: Employees wear several hats and work in various areas

pros: The students are fun to work with.
cons: A very poor and hostile work environment. No benefits, individuals treated horribly, a lot of harassment towards staff.
